com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes

Class JiveRemote

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes.JiveRemote
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Remote

    public class JiveRemote
extends Object
implements Remote
    Implements the Jive rest api for create/update/delete of documents. Does not currently support OAuth as I do not have access to a Jive instance that supports it. 
     
 ---
 remote:
   baseUrl: "https://jive.com/api/core/v3"
   username: "username"
   password: "password"
   supportsNativeMarkdown: false
   datetimeFormat: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ"
   requestTimeout: 60
   class: "com.github.macgregor.alexandria.remotes.jive.JiveRemote"
   defaultExtraProps:
      jiveParentUri: "https://jive.com/groups/alexandria-test-group"
 metadata:
 - sourcePath: "docs/images.md"
   title: "images.md"
   remoteUri: "https://jive.com/docs/DOC-1140818"
   sourceChecksum: 1751689934
   convertedChecksum: 2834756773
   createdOn: "2018-08-22T02:27:48.644+0000"
   lastUpdated: "2018-08-22T02:27:51.789+0000"
   extraProps:
     jiveParentUri: "https://jive.com/groups/alexandria-test-group"
     jiveParentPlaceId: "1448512"
     jiveParentApiUri: "https://jive.com/api/core/v3/places/1448512"
     jiveContentId: "1448517"
     jiveTrackingTag: "fb25f4ee-b084-4bb2-a96f-3e656449ca20"
    Config.RemoteConfig#defaultExtraProps and Config.DocumentMetadata#extraProps:
    • USER DEFINED "jiveParentUri" - the uri used to access a parent place for the document. Setting this is how you link a Jive document with the place where it will live. This will not be used for the api calls as the api needs a different URI (of course). This is the link a human can easily find in their browser, we have to search for the place to get the details needed by the content api. See findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveContentId" - the identifier Jive uses for a document, hard for the user to get themselves. We either set it when we create the document or look it up from Config.DocumentMetadata#remoteUri. See findDocument(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveParentPlaceId" - the identifier Jive uses for a place. Set when we lookup the parent place from the user defined "jiveParentUri". See findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveParentApiUri" - this is the actual api uri for a parent place. Set when we lookup the parent place from the user defined "jiveParentUri". See findParentPlace(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)
    • "jiveTrackingTag" - this is a tag set to help Alexandria track documents created or updated in case it needs to find them later. Poor performance on the Jive instance can easily lead to state like the create request timing out but still going through server side. We need to be able to locate documents easily without knowing the Config.DocumentMetadata#remoteUri or "jiveContentId"
    See Also:
    Introduction to the Jive REST API

      • delete

        public void delete(Context context,
                   Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
            throws IOException
        Potentially three requests can be made here, because the Jive api handles requests for deleted documents poorly. Firstly, the usual GET baseUrl/contents if the metadata is missing the "jiveContentId". After that attempts to delete a document that is already deleted will yield a 403 unauthorized. So if for some reason Alexandria's state gets messed up and it tries to re-delete a document it will get an unexpected error. We avoid that by fetching the document directly via GET baseUrl/contents/$&#123;{@value #JIVE_CONTENT_ID}&#125;, checking for 403's and only executing DELETE baseUrl/contents/$&#123;{@value #JIVE_CONTENT_ID}&#125; if the document exists. Then we know a 403 is actually an authorization error.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface Remote
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Get Content, Jive REST API - Delete Content, JiveUtils.needsContentId(Config.DocumentMetadata), findDocument(Context, Config.DocumentMetadata)

      • findDocument

        public JiveData.JiveContent findDocument(Context context,
                                         Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
                                  throws IOException
        Find a document's api identifiers from the human accessible uri. The uri a human uses to access a document (Config.DocumentMetadata#remoteUri) is not the uri we need to make rest requests. There is an sort of identifier in this uri, but we have to extract it and then run a search for it to get the "jiveContentId" which we can use to modify the document.
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - metadata to find on remote
        Returns:
        the matching JiveData.JiveContent or null if it wasnt found
        Throws:
        IOException - there was a problem with the request
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Get Contents, Finding the Content ID and Place ID using Jive v3 API

      • findParentPlace

        public void findParentPlace(Context context,
                            Config.DocumentMetadata metadata)
                     throws IOException
        Find a parent place's api identifiers from the human accessible uri. Just like with documents, the parent uri a human interacts with is not the same as the one we need for rest requests. This gives us the "jiveParentApiUri" to use in the post body of create and update requests. The api we are calling for this is very limiting and inaccurate. To compensate for this we run a series of queries of decreasing accuracy:
        1. api/core/v3/places?filter=relationship(member)
        2. api/core/v3/places?filter=relationship(following)
        3. api/core/v3/places?filter=relationship(owner)
        4. api/core/v3/places?filter=search(JiveUtils.jiveParentPlaceName(String))
        All of these require client side filtering to match the place name to the name extracted from the uri. The last query really is a last resort as it is slow and is a coin toss on whether you will find the place or not. For best results, the Jive user Alexandria uses should be made a member, owner or follower of the places it will be using.
        Parameters:
        context - current Alexandria context
        metadata - document that needs parent details
        Throws:
        IOException - there was a problem with the request
        See Also:
        Jive REST API - Get Places, Finding the Content ID and Place ID using Jive v3 API
